programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Dangerous crevices The young climbers and their guide leave Rifugio Monzino heading for the foot of Mont-Blanc, where they hope to pitch their first bivouac. To do so, they must cross a crevice-covered glacier. Time to apply everything they learned. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 7:

In Vanves, a visit to Pierre Basse's wrought iron workshop. All about the apron. In Lille, Le Colonel is a company specialising in the artisanal manufacture of bow ties, ties and braces. How to wear asymmetric clothing. In Romans-sur-Isère, Un Si Beau Pas makes luxury footwear.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Sébastien Ripari
Expert in international gastronomy, Sébastien Ripari reveals a little-known Paris, one of narrow cobbled streets, busy everyday markets, culinary institutions and secret addresses. For the "friend of the chefs", the French capital is a celebration, preferably involving glorious food and shared with friends.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a nomadic family The Roldan-Forest family have lived, worked and schooled their children in their bus for the last seven years. What made the couple want to offer their children this alternative lifestyle? Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Bordeaux court of appeal. Textile designer Sophie Mallebranche weaves metal thread using innovative industrial techniques. Discovering the Paris of the workers. A poetic stroll in the area around Rouen, where the porcelain sculptures by the ceramist Marik Korus take the colour white to another level. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: The Ephrussi Garden Before the cooper comes the stave maker, the craftsman who selects and crafts the wood used to make barrels. Growing fruit and vegetables, or the art of bringing people together on a university campus. Visiting the gardens of the Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild. Don't panic: return to Bérangère's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Mountain rescue Departure at sunrise. One of the candidates must drop out. Injured the previous day, he needs to be airlifted by helicopter. The young climbers provide first aid. There'll be no helicopter rescue on the expedition. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc: Spotlight on headgear by La Cerise sur le Chapeau. All there is to know about the roll neck. Encounter with André Sakellarides, stringed-instrument maker in Marseille. How to wear wellington boots. A deliciously sweet visit to a veritable institution in Lille: Maison Meert reveals the recipe for its waffles. Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
François Gagnaire
Chef François Gagnaire, today based in Paris, returns to the Haute-Loire and his town of Le Puy-en-Velay, where he has never been forgotten. We accompany him on a distinctly foodie pilgrimage, across the region that revealed his talent and where he earned his first Michelin star.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a multigenerational farm In Saskatchewan, Julien settles on a farm that's totally off-grid and into the radically ecological lifestyle of its inhabitants. And he's about to learn a lot from this family that lives its convictions to the full! Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Monaco special Behind the scenes at the famous Monte-Carlo casino. Encounter with the chef Marcel Ravin in charge of the kitchens of the Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel & Resort, where he offers an innovative and sophisticated gastronomic cuisine. Gaming and roulette tables: the expertise of the Monte-Carlo workshops. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: It's time to revise your scales and arpeggios ready for an appointment behind the scenes of the Paris Philharmonic. The youngest Michelin-starred chef in France welcomes us to her restaurant. We discover some of the well-kept gourmet secrets of Julia Sedefdjian, chef at the Baieta. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: The Ephrussi Garden Before the cooper comes the stave maker, the craftsman who selects and crafts the wood used to make barrels. Growing fruit and vegetables, or the art of bringing people together on a university campus. Visiting the gardens of the Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild. Don't panic: return to Bérangère's garden. programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Beet cupcakes
Ricardo prepares a root vegetable for dessert: beet cupcakes topped with mascarpone cream and drizzled with beet syrup.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
En-route for the Gras de Douarnenez
With five days of festivities the Gras de Douarnenez is a carnival on a grand scale! One of the last in Brittany or even in France, this fabulous celebration, open to everyone and every age, sees the entire town dress up and enjoy a chance to laugh at absolutely anything. Report by: Nina Montagné.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Conciergerie to explore the fascinating Gothic monument. Joséphine Fossey talks about Atelier 27 and her creative partnership with Florence Lipszyc. The spiciest addresses in the French capital. Between tradition and modernity, a focus on artistic metalwork and the sublime craftsmanship of the Steaven Richard workshop. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
The Liberation of Paris Museum/Pierre Marty/Off-White/Plumavera.
The Liberation of Paris Museum recounts the Second World War. Chef Pierre Marty at work in the kitchens of "Ducasse sur Seine", a boat unlike any other. Off-White, with its extravagant fabrics and over-sized volumes. An in-depth look at Plumavera's exquisite expertise with feathers.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Magret de canard aux quatre baies
programme.desc: Duck breast with a four pepper sauce Pasquale Vari presents her duck breast with roast Brussels sprouts and explains how to make a four pepper sauce. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Maison de vétéran In the middle of the 20th century, to solve the housing crisis, Canada saw the construction of tens of thousands of quick-build houses, each to the same square design: known as "wartime housing" or "maisons de vétérans". Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Brock and East York, Ontario
In Brock, Ontario, Louis saves the life of a large number of frogs. In Toronto, he comes to the rescue of six skunks.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Nordic food Three guests born in Scandinavia come together to cook dishes from their respective regions: Sweden, Norway and Denmark. Mahée Paiement joins the gang to relive her travel memories! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.sub-title: Le best of de la saison
programme.desc: Season's highlights For this final programme, Katharina Locher catches up with the gardeners in an exceptional spot: the MFO Park in Zurich. Between walls and columns of greenery, they look back at the best moments of the season. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris for a rendezvous behind the scenes at the Sainte-Chapelle as we discover the hidden side of this religious monument. We then meet the young Swiss designer Eliane Heutschi, an up-and-coming talent in the world of fashion who mixes materials and techniques for her resolutely modern creations. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 1

A little crooked house... but can a house really be crooked, literally? Who lives in a villa with direct lake access? How to blossom in a rainbow-coloured house next to a railway line? Viola Tami invites us to discover some surprising buildings and their occupants. Presented by: Viola Tami.

Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc:
Aravis, around Annecy
Laurent invites us to join him as he discovers this region between Lake Annecy and the Aravis mountain range, as seen by those who live there.
Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Holy Trinity Orthodox Cathedral. The experimental designer Marlène Huissoud weaves her artistic web around a world where man and insect cohabit. A Parisian journey in the footsteps of the film-maker Michel Audiard. Caroline Cochet and the endless possibilities offered by the Japanese shibori dyeing technique. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
